thread.title: Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce Invites Non-Golfers to Attend Dinner at the 37th Annual Golf Outing
thread.title_full: Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce Invites Non-Golfers to Attend Dinner at the 37th Annual Golf Outing

author: Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce
title: Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce Invites Non-Golfers to Attend Dinner at the 37th Annual Golf Outing
text: Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce Press Release Receive press releases from Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce: By Email RSS Feeds: Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce Invites Non-Golfers to Attend Dinner at the 37th Annual Golf Outing Everyone interested in participating at the Morton Grove Chamber's 37th Annual Golf Outing can participate in the event by attending dinner after the golfers have come off the Chevy Chase Golf Club course on September 16, 2015. Morton Grove, IL, September 10, 2015 --( PR.com )-- Located at 1000 North Milwaukee Avenue in Wheeling, IL 60090, those interested in participating with the Morton Grove Chamber's biggest fund-raising events can sit down to dinner with the golfers and their local business, community and government leaders to enjoy an evening of networking. Dinner is just $40 and can be reserved by contacting the Chamber's Golf Committee at 847-965-0330 or by email at director@mgcci.org by Monday, September 14, 2015.Chamber President Jeannine Como said, "We understand that many people running their business can't get always away from work during the day or just don't play golf. We wanted to offer them a place at our event to help promote their businesses."The Chevy Chase Golf Club has been hosting golfers since 1927, designed by renowned architect Thomas Bendelow. The championship 18-hole course was renovated in 2002 by Bob Lohmann. There are 125 acres with deep pot bunkers lined with native grasses along with rolling greens and bent grass fairways coupled with four sets of tees to challenge players at all skill levels.Founded in 1926, the Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce and Industry is dedicated to promoting and advocating for the local business community to ensure the continued economic, cultural and civic well-being of Morton Grove. We are a vehicle for business to work collectively to build their business and enhance the economic make-up of the community. We inform businesses and advocate on their behalf about local, state and federal issues.For More Information, Contact:Morton Grove Chamber of Commerce6101 Capulina Avenue
